questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to exhibit. An engineer is investigating an intrusion and is analyzing the pcap file. Which two key elements must an engineer consider? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AB
Answer : A & B
Yes, I agree with inbatnom, the SYN packets are not being acknowledged.

Selected Answer: AB
Answer is A & B. The SYN packets are not being acknowledged

choices.E: same source IP address with a destination port 80
choices.D: identical length of 120 and window size (64)
choices.A: variable "info" field and unchanging sequence number
choices.C: SYN packets acknowledged from several source IP addresses
choices.B: high volume of SYN packets with very little variance in time

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
The presence of /bin/sh -c id indicates that the attacker is attempting to execute the id command, which is commonly used to obtain information about the current user and the groups they belong to on the system. This is a clear indicator of a command injection attempt.

Therefore, the correct answer is option A: command injection.

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. Which attack is being attempted against a web application?
What is the impact of false negative alerts when compared to true negative alerts?

choices.D: A false negative is an event that alerts for injection attack when no attack is happening, and a true negative is an attack that happens and an alert that is appropriately raised.
choices.C: A true negative is a legitimate attack that triggers a brute force alert, and a false negative is when no alert and no attack is occurring.
choices.B: A true negative is an alert for an exploit attempt when no attack was detected, and a false negative is when no attack happens and an alert is still raised.
choices.A: A false negative is someone trying to hack into the system and no alert is raised, and a true negative is an event that never happened and an alert was not raised.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Answer is A real attack but no alert.

questions.question_text:
A company receptionist received a threatening call referencing stealing assets and did not take any action assuming it was a social engineering attempt. Within
48 hours, multiple assets were breached, affecting the confidentiality of sensitive information. What is the threat actor in this incident?

discussion.content:
"C" is correct.
Threat actors are the individuals (or a group of individuals) who perform an attack or are responsible for a security incident that impacts or has the potential of impacting an organization or individual. There are several types of threat actors:
Script kiddies, Organized crime groups, State sponsors and governments, Hacktivists, Terrorist groups.

Cisco CyberOps Associate CBROPS 200-201 Official Cert Guide
By Omar Santos

Selected Answer: C
C is the correct answer.

For those people who don't know this word.
Perpetrator is a person who carries out a harmful, illegal, or immoral act.
Three different dumps.... three different answers on this question....

comments.content: C makes total sense to me....

discussion.content: what does it have to do with this " perpetrators of the attack" ??

C is the right answer
"A threat actor or malicious actor is a person or entity responsible for an event or incident that impacts, or has the potential to impact, the safety or security of another entity"
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Threat_actor

questions.question_text: What matches the regular expression r(ege)+x?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
The correct answer is:
A. r(ege)x

The same as with Question #292

Explanation of the Regular Expression r(ege)+x:
r: The string must start with the letter r.
(ege)+:
The group (ege) must appear at least once (due to the + quantifier). This means one or more consecutive instances of the exact sequence ege are required.
x: The string must end with the letter x.
